titlestmt.titleproper: Near East Foundation records, Accession 2010:002, RG 2
A Guide to the Near East Foundation records, Accession 2010:002, RG 2 FA1305

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-07-01 02:16:52 -0400.

did.unittitle: Near East Foundation records, Accession 2010:002, RG 2

physdesc.extent: 12 standard record storage boxes, 1 letter document box, and 1 oversize photo box holding at-risk materials

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged item may be restricted at the discretion of RAC. The bound volume in box 14 will require assistance from an archivist.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Library materials have been separated from the body of the collection and are available via RAC's library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Level 3 Standard Processing has been conducted to establish basic intellectual and physical control of the material and assess immediate preservation and conservation needs. Material remains in order received, with select non-unique materials transferred to the RAC library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to RAC in 2010 by the Near East Foundation and ingested by RAC as Accession 2010:002.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This record group primarily consists of dockets, minutes and reports of Near East Relief (NER) and the Near East Foundation (NEF). Materials pertaining to Near East Relief date from 1915 to roughly 1932, while materials pertaining to the Near East Foundation date from roughly 1932 to 2005. A majority of the materials were generated by and for New York-based personnel, and document executive-level decision making. However, information on day-to-day foreign operations can be found in the dockets, which include reports that reference foundation-operated orphanages and schools. Those interested in visual sources can look to the issues of the "New Near East" newletter, 1922 to 1924, and the "Bulletin of the Near East Society", 1952-1955.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Rockefeller Archive Center has title, copyright, and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them, and has authority to grant permission to cite and publish archival material from the collection.

physdesc.extent: 12 standard record storage boxes and one document box
